name: VASOPRESSIN

indications.text: vasopressin injection indicated increase blood pressure adults vasodilatory shock remain hypotensive despite fluids catecholamines .

contraindications.text: • dilute 20 units/ml single dose vial contents normal saline ( 0.9 % sodium chloride ) 5 % dextrose water ( d5w ) either 0.1 units/ml 1 unit/ml intravenous . discard unused diluted solution 18 hours room temperature 24 hours refrigeration . ( 2.1 ) • post-cardiotomy shock : 0.03 0.1 units/minute ( 2.2 ) • septic shock : 0.01 0.07 units/minute ( 2.2 )

warningsAndPrecautions: vasopressin injection , usp clear , practically colorless solution intravenous available : product code unit sale strength unit rf930101 ndc 65219-039-01a tray 25 single dose vials 20 units per 1 ml ndc 65219-039-001 ml single dose vial store 2°c 8°c ( 36°f 46°f ) . freeze . vials may held 12 months upon removal refrigeration room temperature storage conditions ( 20°c 25°c [ 68°f 77°f ] , [ usp controlled room temperature ] ) , anytime within labeled shelf life . removed refrigeration , unopened vial marked indicate revised 12 month expiration date . manufacturer 's original expiration date shorter revised expiration date , shorter date must used . vasopressin injection beyond manufacturer 's expiration date stamped vial . storage conditions expiration periods summarized following table . unopened refrigerated2°c 8°c ( 36°f 46°f ) unopened room temperature20°c 25°c ( 68°f 77°f ) store 25°c ( 77°f ) 1 ml vial manufacturer expiration date 12 months manufacturer expiration date , whichever earlier 451491a
adverseReactions: vasopressin injection 1 ml single dose vial contain chlorobutanol therefore contraindicated patients known allergy hypersensitivity 8-l-arginine vasopressin .
indications_original: Vasopressin injection is indicated to increase blood pressure in adults with vasodilatory shock who remain hypotensive despite fluids and catecholamines.
contraindications_original: • Dilute 20 units/mL single dose vial contents with normal saline (0.9% sodium chloride) or 5% dextrose in water (D5W) to either 0.1 units/mL or 1 unit/mL for intravenous administration. Discard unused diluted solution after 18 hours at room temperature or 24 hours under refrigeration. ( 2.1 ) • Post-cardiotomy shock: 0.03 to 0.1 units/minute ( 2.2 ) • Septic shock: 0.01 to 0.07 units/minute ( 2.2 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Vasopressin injection, USP is a clear, practically colorless solution for intravenous administration available as: 
                  
                     
                     
                     
                     
                     
                        
                           
                              
                                 Product Code
                              
                           
                           
                              
                                 Unit of Sale
                              
                           
                           
                              
                                 Strength
                              
                           
                           
                              
                                 Unit of Use
                              
                           
                        
                        
                           
                              RF930101 
                           
                           
                              NDC 65219-039-01A tray of 25 Single Dose Vials 
                           
                           
                              20 Units per 1 mL 
                           
                           
                              NDC 65219-039-001 mL Single Dose Vial 
                           
                        
                     
                  
                  Store between 2°C and 8°C (36°F and 46°F). Do not freeze. 
                  Vials may be held up to 12 months upon removal from refrigeration to room temperature storage conditions (20°C to 25°C [68°F to 77°F], [see USP Controlled Room Temperature]), anytime within the labeled shelf life. Once removed from refrigeration, unopened vial should be marked to indicate the revised 12 month expiration date. If the manufacturer's original expiration date is shorter than the revised expiration date, then the shorter date must be used. Do not use Vasopressin injection beyond the manufacturer's expiration date stamped on the vial. 
                  The storage conditions and expiration periods are summarized in the following table. 
                  
                     
                     
                     
                     
                        
                           
                           
                              Unopened Refrigerated2°C to 8°C (36°F to 46°F) 
                           
                           
                              Unopened Room Temperature20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F)Do not store above 25°C (77°F) 
                           
                        
                        
                           
                              1 mL Vial 
                           
                           
                              Until manufacturer expiration date 
                           
                           
                              12 months or until manufacturer expiration date, whichever is earlier 
                           
                        
                     
                  
                  
                  451491A
adverseReactions_original: Vasopressin injection 1 mL single dose vial does not contain chlorobutanol and is therefore contraindicated only in patients with a known allergy or hypersensitivity to 8-L-arginine vasopressin.
